website_summaries.verdict: Long battery life in a popular mouse design. Highly trusted manufacturer name in Logitech.
pros: Extremely easy to set up and use
Comfortable shape to hold for extended periods of time
Small mouse that you can carry with you for use with a laptop
cons: Some packages ship without the receiver, so mouse won't work

customer_reviews.title: After 8 months the mouse quit working. When I ...
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months the mouse quit working. When I put new batteries in, it would work for about a minute then go dead. After jumping through all of the hoops to supply the needed warranty information they still would not replace it, or issue a refund, but wanted me to perform all of these changes to my computer. I'm 68 y/o and not about to learn how to do everything they wanted me to do, I'll just buy from a different manufacturer from now on. I've been a long time customer..... they blew it for $9.99.
customer_reviews.author: BeaverIslander

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive yet Reliable Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very inexpensive yet functional mouse available in market. It came with a nano receiver which goes into USB port of the laptop or can ben stored inside the mouse when travelling. It’s a plug and play device and I haven’t had any issue with browsing or formatting basic shapes in PowerPoint. Build quality is great and I am enjoying it a lot. It has only two buttons and scroll wheel but for a wireless mouse with great precision and reliability, price is just about right ($11.49 as of 02/13/2016). Overall, it’s a great product and I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: biomeddit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on bad surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a home theater system, which means it's often operating 10 to 12 ft away on surfaces such as arm rests, couch cushions, coffee tables, etc. This mouse does better in that environment than the more expensive models I've tried. The battery also lasts a long time (1 yr and still going on another computer). The only negative things I find are it's light-weight, cheaper feel, and it's not uncommon for the battery compartment to pop open when dropped on the floor. I'll accept both of those problems for an inexpensive mouse that I can use anywhere and on any surface in my living room. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: YoBro

customer_reviews.title: Nope, it will break under regular use.
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase a new Logitech because the last one, which I had for years, was left behind at a coffee shop. This new one worked for one week. I went through three batteries and a lot of time, thinking it was me. I set it down and forgot to write the seller but now the 30 day guarantee is expired and they won't replace. They want me to take it up with Logitech. I think I purchased about 40 days ago, but used it 7 days. So, if you are busy and don't want to keep up with guarantees and timelines for a product that will break. Don't buy this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The first one shipped to me was junk, didn't work at all. If the replacement works, I'll update my review. Update: The second mouse worked fine. Feels cheap but the cost was right. Overall, I'd say this is a workable product and a good value. This is a further update on my earlier review: This is total junk. After 1 month of use, the right click button works sporadically. I'm about ready to throw it out the window. Pick another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: I took one star off because it's not ergonomically great (I have other wireless mice that are nicer in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected for a portable mouse. I took one star off because it's not ergonomically great (I have other wireless mice that are nicer in my hand). I gave four stars because the battery hasn't run out even though I never turn it off, the mouse is reliable, has appropriate sensitivity, never has problems connecting wirelessly to the receiver, and the initial setup was automatic so I didn't have to download any drivers myself.
customer_reviews.author: Young Adult in a Big City

customer_reviews.title: Sudden Death
customer_reviews.text: This mouse lasted for 2 months and 10 days, then inexplicably and totally died. It wasn't dropped, it wasn't subjected to extreme temperatures, nothing. It just died. Thought at first the battery had died, even though the product advertises a very long battery life. Changed battery three times, verified the batteries were charged with a meter, and zippo. It's dead, Jim. Previous logitech mouse lasted five years. What a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Girl

customer_reviews.title: You can never go wrong with Logitech
customer_reviews.text: These Logitech mouses are hands down the best on the market. I still have the same exact one from 8 years ago. I ordered 2 more just to have as back ups in the future. I can't remember home many countless times I've dropped my mouse, how many times the battery came off or the battery lid flew off. Till this day, my mouth still works with laser precision. HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!!!
customer_reviews.author: ALEX G.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Just an update on this product: My guess is that the quality of these mice have gone down hill. My latest logitech mouse didn't even last three months! So disappointing. This is probably the second or third Logitech mouse I've purchased in 6 years. I think they work great and are a good value. One of the sensor stickers fell off the bottom of my last mouse after about 2 years, so I had to buy another. But for a mouse in the $20 range, this one is an excellent choice. Battery life is excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: RobinATL

customer_reviews.title: NOT Bluetooth, very small
customer_reviews.text: This mouse came up under "full size mouse", however, it is definitely NOT full size. it is very small and compact and not comfortable to hold, unfortunately. Also, the product information on the chart at the bottom of page indicates that this mouse connects via Bluetooth and that is also NOT the case. I wanted a bluetooth mouse as my old computer's USB ports are failing and this mouse requires nano-receiver. Disppointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon West

customer_reviews.title: Small size - cheap feel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a failing Logitech wireless mouse that's served me well for years. My initial impressions of this new one are that the quality seems lacking. Left and right clicks need a firm and steady pressure to activate. The mouse is fairly small which may be useful for someone with small hands. For me I find I have to arch my hand a fair bit to hold the mouse while clicking the buttons. I may keep this for occasional use with my laptop but will be ordering something different.
customer_reviews.author: Durango Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very good, basic mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of this mouse. It does not have any complex features, but this is a good thing. Just point and click! It's pretty small and easy to hold comfortably in your hand, and it is very quiet - you will barely hear it when clicking. From my previous experience wit this particular model, it's good for about a year and a half to two years. The battery life is average.
customer_reviews.author: V.S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Laptop Mouse...Works Without Red Light Illuminated...
customer_reviews.text: Super notebook/lap top mouse...Just the right size, price, and installed and works perfectly with my old Vista laptop...About the only thing I will say about it is the little light that glows red on every mouse I have owned is not on with this one..The little light is there but there is no illumination from it. Completely dark like there was no battery in it...I thought I got a bum one but it is working perfectly...Just in case you notice the same thing and it works..
customer_reviews.author: John ThomasTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With Logitech Products
customer_reviews.text: Mouse performs exactly as expected. As the headline says, folks, you can't go wrong with a Logitech product, mouse or otherwise. Have used Logitech mice and a bunch of other products and I am yet to be disappointed. Yes, they may cost a bit more than other products, and even knockoffs, but their price is absolutely WORTH every penny if you want quality, reliability, and durability. A highly recommended product from a proven manufacturer of top-notch products!!
customer_reviews.author: QBN

customer_reviews.title: so it constantly feels like it's slipping out of your hand
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this mouse is the "feel". It is small in general, but also smaller toward your palm, and a bit wider near the fingertips, which feels totally backward. In addition, there is no rubber grip around the outside, so it constantly feels like it's slipping out of your hand. Other than that, it works great, and would work well for a backup mouse, but for working all day, not going to work.
customer_reviews.author: NoPoet

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Communication between mouse and cursor on screen became sluggish and unreliable within three weeks of purchase. Inserting a new battery improved performance for less than an hour. I'm returning it feeling frustrated by the hassle of trying to get it work and then packaging it for mailing, but grateful for Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Trekking Granny

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a Friday night, and it was delivered on Sunday morning. Incredible!! The mouse works great. All you do is plug in the dongle and away you go. I haven't used a mouse for many years because I got tendonitis at one point. I'll have to get a bean bag to make sure my forearm is level with my wrist and the top of my hand. I like the apple mouse because they're very low. You don't have to curve your hand around them very high. But this is a good mouse. It works on my vintage gray Ice patterned kitchen table, no mouse pad required.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: This item cost a lot, promised a lot, but is a fail. Battery stopped working after a short time. Mouse controls fluctuate wildly -- for instance the scroll wheel will go from slow to fast and then stop working entirely. Not good for gaming. Program functions don't work. Logitech is shamelessly selling this junk.
customer_reviews.author: MarkB

customer_reviews.title: Ideal laptop mouse - long wearing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse several years ago for my laptop. It has performed flawlessly. Easy to use - just insert the battery, plug the USB connector into the pc port, and go! It couldn't be simpler. Years later, it's still going strong and I will be purchasing another for my 2nd laptop. I really like the fact that the USB can be stored within the battery compartment for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not the mouse it used to be
customer_reviews.text: This is the third mouse of this model line that I've purchased. I am struck by a lighter overall feel, a battery compartment lid held only by a detent rather than the former button latch, a slightly loose battery spring post, a scratchy feel when rolling the wheel, as opposed to the former smooth movement to the wheel and a less distinguishable line-ratchet feel when rolling the wheel. It seems to work OK, but it just feels much less substantial in weight and operational sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Genie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless mouse that I use when I am on the go. It is small and compact and the batteries last a long time. I had one of these previously and it lasted about 3 years before it stopped working. I liked it so much that I instantly bought another one when my previous one broke. This mouse consists of a small USB receiver and the mouse itself. The mouse has 3 buttons, with the third being a scroll wheel that also clicks. Very simple and well built mouse that I take with me when I take my laptop different places.
customer_reviews.author: ryguy

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a faulty unit?
customer_reviews.text: I have used a loved previous Logitech wireless mice. The unifying adapter is small and the setup is basically non-existent. This one seems to hang up when clicking. It wants to drag whatever I click on, and I end up having to try and click through links multiple times to get them to work. I have used separate mice on the PC without issue, which leads me to this mouse. While it isn't debilitating, it is certainly very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: This is a great entry-level wireless mouse if you're looking for something to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry-level wireless mouse if you're looking for something to get you by. The tracking is good, but lacks a smoothness that you'll find with the higher-end units on the market. It's about the size of a business card, so it's small enough to travel with, but not too small that you can't use it with your normal home computer. Battery life: I use it everyday for 6-10 hours and the batteries will last 6+ months Pros: Good price point, good size for traveling, decent tracking. Cons: I've noticed some lagging from time to time on certain devices
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 3-4 months, then stopped
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this mouse for the first 3-4 months I had it, but it suddenly stopped working. I did all of the normal things one would do such as change the battery, restart my computer, etc. but nothing helped. It would work for a few seconds and then stop. Got a mouse from a different brand that seems to be working fine, so I don't think it is the computer. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Asuka

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing this Logitech Wireless Mouse. I purchased this mouse to use with my work lap top for when I am in conferences or meetings. I found myself replacing the wired mouse in my office and using this one in its place. So it has become my primary mouse whether in a meeting or in my office. Logitech never dissapoints. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a wireless solution.
customer_reviews.author: Parkland_C6

customer_reviews.title: Perfect affordable mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had to ditch my old mouse because there was no manual off switch (which was very annoying when having to carry it around in my backpack - it would abhorrently click things on my tablet). This mouse is super affordable, comfortable, and small enough for my tiny hands. The click is pretty loud but the scroll is relatively quiet. I will add that it's pretty sensitive which I also like because sometimes I'm studying with limited space, and got used to it pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: MaryBethHampe

customer_reviews.title: Still Using Over 3 Years Later!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mouse. I am still using it over 3 years later on my main screen (I run a dual setup for gaming). It is comfortable, light, and accurate. All of my mice are from Logitech- including my gaming mice- and I have been nothing but pleased with the performance. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sixtus

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Trash, Senor on the mouse stops working for no reason all the time
customer_reviews.text: I never review anything I buy because generally I never complain, and if something works, it's intended to work so why review it. THIS IS THE WORST MOUSE I HAVE EVER BOUGHT. I will be trying to move it a lil and NOPE. It doesn't budge. I have to throw the mouse upside down several times before it starts working again. I literally have a technique to 360 spin my mouse (like juggle it) to make it work again. This mouse is so worthless and is easily the worst purchase I have ever made online. This seems cheap, but Logitech right? That's why I bought it. BUT IT'S STRAIGHT TRASH PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID
customer_reviews.author: Joshua On

customer_reviews.title: It has worked without a hitch for almost three years
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use (I'm female with large hands, like I can do a 10-key span on the piano). I'm so used to things breaking these days in no time at all, but this has worked for years and my laptop is on year 8, so I'm having good electronics karma or buying from good companies. : ) Next time I need a mouse, I will go with this company, even in this particular mouse is no longer being sold.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse for Laptops - Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is compact and connects very easily to my machine. I set it up once and haev had no issues with setup since. It still has the original battery in it; Great battery life. I use this with a laptop computer since I don't like track pads. For the price this is a sweet deal! I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: MrNate

customer_reviews.title: A Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's just a mouse, but this model is tried and true. And this is my second one so you know I'm really satisfied with it. It never fails on the connection and fits in the palm of my hand easily. I do not get fatigued and the mouse itself is very responsive. The price is very fair and I can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Using These Logitech Mice All Through This Century!
customer_reviews.text: I love Logitech's cordless mice. I've been using them for years. I leave mine on all the time. They require one AA battery and even 24/7 it will last more than a month, several months sometimes. They're stupidly inexpensive and durable and I've never had a problem with losing the signal. Precision is adequate, although if you're into intense gaming you might want to buy a high-definition mouse. I'm sure Logitech makes one of those, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Denny

customer_reviews.title: I would not purchase. Cheap and too small.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap and too small. There would be no way that you could game on this. This was purchased for someone who was using this for daily work/browsing and still was not a good mouse. I would look into other companies instead of logitech also for mouse because I’ve only had problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: JimLaheySunnyvale

customer_reviews.title: Try something else first.
customer_reviews.text: It was cheap enough, but the response on it is pretty bad. Any movement to the right, and the pointer wants to go up as well. Anything to the left, and it wants to also go downward. At first, i thought it was me, but after testing with two other mice, I found that they responded correctly to the movement. Sad to have wasted my $$ on this.
customer_reviews.author: Boatboy24

customer_reviews.title: Great speedy service and product
customer_reviews.text: I am using this mouse with my lap top. I loved that it was immediate use with no complicated set-up. So far the mouse is working perfectly. I don't do gaming, so I can't speak to that aspect of this product, but otherwise I am extremely pleased. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lutrell Bowers

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but...
customer_reviews.text: Is as pictured and works like it is supposed to. I dislike the USB being so small, but only because my Surface Pro 2 only has one USB port and I have to remove the USB if I need the port for another purpose. I just fear that I will lose it in the midst of my busy life if it is not immediately put back into the port. Other than that, I really like it! It is a great fit for my hand and it looks like it could work for both a left or right-handed person. UPDATE: After only four months, the mouse has completely stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: DoWorkEatBacon

customer_reviews.title: No buttons on the side! Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Some people may want or even need a mouse with extra buttons under their thumb, but not this old dog. These Logitech are well built, durable, comfortable, and have only two buttons and a scroll wheel (which can be used as a third button also, but not unintentionally). Just exactly what a mouse ought to be, for someone like me.
customer_reviews.author: Old_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: After my off-brand mouse bit the dust, I decided to go with a trusted name for its replacement. I've always been a fan of Logitech products for their extended life as well as being ergo conscience. ***NOTE*** Not sure if this is normal but.. when I installed the battery, after inserting the USB into the laptop and confirming the mouse was ON, I never saw the optic red light come on. In fact, it’s NEVER come on. That said, I have experienced NO issues with performance! Very happy with this purchase and hope the unit, as well as battery life, live for a lot longer than one year!
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Low quality for Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my previous Logitech, this mouse is cheaply made. It does "just work" with all computers like only Logitech's do, but I don't know how long it will last. My last Logitech lasted 5 years of travel, but I'll be lucky to get a year out of this one. It's also smaller (too small) compared to a normal mouse. Spend a few bucks more and get a better version Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap - Dead in the box
customer_reviews.text: Right away I noticed that it just felt cheaply made. I replaced my regular mouse with this one and the cursor would not behave like I was trying to use it. It froze - It disappeared - It skipped across the screen. I am returning mine for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rob-n-TX

customer_reviews.title: good detents on the scrollwheel if that is what you need.
customer_reviews.text: This M185 replaces a logitech m325. The m325 scrollwheel is too smooth and it is hard to cycle though pictures in lightroom one at time due to almost a complete lack of detents on the wheel mechanism. The m185 is a flatter mouse which fits my hand better and the scrollwheel has nice detents making cycling though pictures in lightroom great again! It has no problem tracking on any surface I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. West

customer_reviews.title: Worked great then died
customer_reviews.text: Have used Logitech as the go-to mouse choice for many years. This little mouse started off great. Usual fast, no-hassle setup. Windows 10 immediately recognized it. Four months later, the mouse stopped working. Quick check determined the mouse would not power on. Changed the battery with a freshly charged battery (Eneloop) - no change. Swapped the battery for a new out of the package alkaline, still no joy. I checked the Logitech web site for warranty repairs/returns. After reviewing the steps, form submission and length of time to have the claim reviewed and processed, it just wasn't worth my time. It's a $10 mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kiolbassa

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for the price. I read the reviews and worried about the tracking due to the sensor not being centered, but I bought it anyway. I am very glad I did. This was not an issue for me at all. I really like the simplicity of this design and size of this mouse. I especially like the micro adapter that doesn't stick out the side of my laptop; much better than the older models that stick out about an inch and a half. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Can't adjust mouse speed because software won't launch
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works, which is why I gave it two stars instead of 1, but the software that allows you to make adjustments to how the mouse responds won't launch. This is a known issue with this mouse and it's a real problem because the tracking of the mouse is super sensitive, which basically means it's really awkward to use and I keep accidentally moving things when trying to select them. I've been in contact with their support and nothing they've had me do has helped. Eventually they just stopped responding.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I like Logitech Brand
customer_reviews.text: I like Logitech Brand, These mice are bullet proof. When I throw away a Logitech is because it doesn't work anymore after years of intensive use. The batteries doesn't last as advertised, but I don't mind. Microsoft mice don last long. You have to throw them away when develop the ghost cursor. This happens when the cursor moves but you don't move the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Logitech "Unifying" devices
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does NOT have the orange unifying logo - therefore it can't be paired with other Logitech devices. I bought this wanting to pair my keyboard and other mouse on the same receiver. After receiving this mouse I discovered the importance of the orange logo. It's my fault for not figuring this out before purchasing, but still a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very mediocre and imprecise mouse
customer_reviews.text: I like that this mouse is small and pretty reliable. Connection works fine, long battery life and all that but it just feels...cheap. I mean it is so can't fault it that much but it doesn't feel like a quality product. The buttons feel very cheap as well and the precision is very poor. There are better options for a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: What is this? A mouse for ants?!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is the perfect travel mouse. It works great. It is freaking small so don't expect to game with it! However, I keep it in my laptop case because the size is a definite advantage. The battery seems to be adequate, it has an on/off switch. The sensor has worked on a variety of surfaces for me including a coffee shop sofa and the side of my pants - which is convenient when standing/moving during presentations.
customer_reviews.author: T James

customer_reviews.title: VFM Branded Mice
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is a good name for computer accessories. Just install the USB dongle on the computer and power on the mouse. That's all you need to do. I have been using Logitech mice and keyboards for the last 3 years without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Morley

customer_reviews.title: Fair price. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Since my little girls finger out how to click the mouse, I have to replace my mouse once or twice a year. Then I found this one. It is really much cheaper than the retail store. I like shopping on amazon. It gives a lot of fairly priced and great quality product. So far so good. Hope it can survive longer under my girls' crazy clicking.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Mouse at a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my Logitech M305 that didn't survive my last business trip. I use it exclusively with my laptop. It's a very close replacement, with the main differences being a smaller wheel and the led doesn't light up and blind me when I'm turning the switch to on. It's very smooth and responsive and behaves better than my old mouse on multicolored and darker surfaces. My old M305 lasted 4 years through very heavy use, so I expect this one will be well worth the little money it cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hios

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Right out off the package inserted transmitter into USB Port and immediate use, works great. My old model was not working when this model was ordered and had changed batteries multiple times to try a fix which did not work. Price was very good. Delivered in two days which I am getting very spoiled by.
customer_reviews.author: charlie c

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but NOT with Logitech unifying receivers.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works as it should, however it does NOT work with Logitech unifying receivers. I bought this hoping that it would work with my existing dongle, it does not. That's unfortunate as I now have two USB ports occupied. Oh well, live an learn.
customer_reviews.author: billdoe

customer_reviews.title: Good value, overall.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these before. In the past they had a green and red color under the On/Off switch so you could easily tell the setting. The colors are gone now. A minor detail but it was convenient. Always the cost-cutting measures going on....
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a year
customer_reviews.text: The mouse was nice overall. Smaller size than average but worked for me. Sad part---lasted just a year :((((((( Now the middle button no longer clicks, but still scrolls. I really need the middle clickers.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Murataeva

customer_reviews.title: Overall ... good
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse ... no problems installing; and for my regular work, it fits the bill. But it's almost TOO "alive" for me when I'm working with my "photoshop-clone" program. It's very hard to go slow with it, and sometimes that's what's needed when you're working with graphics and images. Other than that ... it's just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Katie_Lynne

customer_reviews.title: have been happy with it for months now
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I bought had a kind of 'squeaky' sound when releasing the left button, from the plastic guides rubbing together under the button, just one of those things that can't really be avoided at this price point, a manufacturing anomaly. I just returned it and got a new one, no squeak, have been happy with it for months now, it is my work mouse, so I use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: afss

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse ever
customer_reviews.text: The battery will last for years even while leaving it on. Works on almost all surfaces, even glass. As an added bonus, the laser is invisible so it won't blind you when your kid is throwing it across the room. That reminds me, it has also survived several drops to concrete and still works fine. Can't imagine a better wireless mouse. Good job Logitech
customer_reviews.author: sandra byxbee

customer_reviews.title: Feels light and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Comes with a battery and takes just one battery Seemless plug-n-play (Win7Pro. Did not need download drivers) Con's: Feels light and cheap * Feels like the plastic is cheap * Imprecise vague pointing and clicking * * Compared to the M505, that died (that I am replacing) Review Date: 4-15-2017, Revision A.
customer_reviews.author: AntennaMan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Great price and look but I find this mouse to be too wide, the on/off button to be impossible ergonomically (cannot be turned on or off quickly with thumb; must be turned over and turned off using a finger), and the cursor control to sometimes be unpredictable. Putting this aside and going back to my preferred brand/model.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Mouse works very well
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this mouse. The battery lasts very well. the only complaint I have is every time you drop it the battery cover and battery go flying. Other logitech mouses i have had do not fly apart as easily as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Huey Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the wireless Logitech combo, keyboard and mouse, that uses the unifying plug for both. I recently replaced the M185 mouse with another M185 mouse and it does not connect to the unifying plug. I have to use another plug and usb port. 2016-01-11 I apparently didn't read all the documentation and/or do enough research on the web. I installed and ran Logitech's Unifying Software and it found the mouse and connected it to the unifying plug. I'm changing from 2 stars to 5. My bad.......
customer_reviews.author: Harold Friez

customer_reviews.title: Reliable mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite mouse. I have had a few of these and they always last ages. They can take quite a bit of damage from drops and falls without any issues. The tiny dongle is out of the way and I've never had issues with connectivity. It's easy to pack and go while I commute to college, and I'm not worried about it getting cracked or crushed in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: tehgingerfluff

customer_reviews.title: I will continue to buy this nice portable mouse so long as I need a work ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid but light, battery lasts FOREVER - I am on my 3rd one in 10 years but I am a heavy user and traveler, so it gets tossed into my purse or computer bag on a regular basis. I never remember to turn it "off" and the battery continues to last forever. I will continue to buy this nice portable mouse so long as I need a work USB mouse. Not good for gaming, but perfect for normal office work.
customer_reviews.author: C. McEachern

customer_reviews.title: The Price Is Right And It Works Without Fail
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a simple, cost efficient mouse this is it. You have a left and right button and a scroll wheel. When I got it I plugged it in and started using it immediately without fail or delays. My brand new laptop was a piece of junk so I took it back and got another new laptop and it is working perfectly in that one too. It's light-weight and feels good in my hand. It is everything I was looking for. I am a happy customer
customer_reviews.author: PATOLA

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to use with my laptop for college and served quite well. It was fairly accurate and responsive. However I recentlt built my own gaming pc, and thats where this mouse can't perform. The response times are too long if your a regular gamer, can't expect much out of mouse of this price though. Pros: Portable, great battery, reliable. Cons: Accerleration, response times for gaming, adapter more than a foot away may experience loss in connection.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Martinez

customer_reviews.title: ok - not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why but these don't seem to last a long time. When they work, they are really nice but they do go bad. Ordered these for our office and my guess is that approximately 85% will last a few years but the others last less and need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Wong

customer_reviews.title: Very nice wireless mouse indeed
customer_reviews.text: I prefer wireless mouse when it comes to computers....one less wire to worry about. This mouse comes with 1 AA battery and that's all you need to use this mouse. It works good, no problems and just insert the infrared remote sensor in any computer USB port and turn the mouse on [power switch is on the bottom of this mouse] and you're ready to use it on the computer. I have one for my desktop computer and another one for my laptop computer. Very nicely built and rather small, a little smaller than a typical wired mouse. But I love it and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey 440Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My fourth one?  Fifth?
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying these. Every computer that I use that has a wired mouse, gets one of these eventually. Cheap enough to just give away, but works better than a more expensive mouse. AA Battery lasts 20 years, I think. I don't know for sure, never had to replace a battery in one of these yet. Not sure why Logitech doesn't use this unlimited energy technology in all their mice.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Tillson

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Only one small problem.
customer_reviews.text: This beautiful mouse arrived weeks faster than advertised. It is absolutely gorgeous. The quality is exceptional, especially for the price. The only problem is that on mine, the front headlights don't turn off unless I turn the mouse off. It's so cheap I'm just ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: Glen W.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work when opened!!
customer_reviews.text: Although I did receive this mouse April 1 2020, I just opened today July 28 and it does not work. I replaced the battery but the indicator light does not come on. Can’t return after 30 days. Good thing my customer did not encounter the problem. Bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: The mouse that keeps going.
customer_reviews.text: These mice are great. Battery life is good as I hard ever have to change the battery and I forget to turn it off from time to time. Feels nice in the hand without being to heavy. I have dropped it from time to without it breaking. If you are looking for a standard mouse this is it. If you happen to misplace it you won't feel bad about having to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Austin J

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is well built and works smoothly with my laptop. It responds quite well. I dropped it once but still nothing happened to it. I am impressed with this mouse. My main complain is that I wish it had light as well. Also, the sleep mode is not functional. Overall, it is a good mouse for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kasturi kunwar

customer_reviews.title: would be better. I was wrong
customer_reviews.text: Tried this to replace an old Logitech M325, as I thought the lighter weight, and smaller size, would be better. I was wrong. It's too light, and too low. The scroll wheel doesn't tilt, which I need for my Back button when web browsing. It was a $10 lesson learned. I'll throw it in a box, and maybe dig it out if a guest has forgotten theirs. For $5 more, get the Logitech M325. It's a far better mouse.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Feels real cheap and did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, put in a new battery switch on and dongle in PC. Nothing. It very light weight and nothing like a Lenova mouse I was trying to replace. I am some what surprised Logitech but out such a low end product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: Love This Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the feel of the Logitech mouse. It's light weight and just as good as the more expensive brands. It's a simple connect to my laptop. Basically a plus and play. It's a lot more convenient for both business and personal needs than the laptop mouse. I'd recommend Logitech any day for anyone. Don't bother wasting money on others. Just use Logitech. The keyboards are great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Ali P

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: My wireless mouse was slow and the connection wasn't always reliable. I hooked this one up and immediately was connected. I love that the little Nano Receiver barely juts out. The movement is smooth. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: krs

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, a friend recommended this to me
customer_reviews.text: I am always unconcentrated to do a thing, but I have a very important job need to achieve recently. So, I was thinking if a supplement could help with my focus. Fortunately, a friend recommended this to me, I bought two to have a try. It seems working well on me, I calmed down and finished my job. Thanks. BTW, if you have the same problem, give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Zhoumingyan

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Fast Delivery, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is a well known brand among computer peripherals. I do not think Logitech makes a bad product. Some are cheap, but still all are good products. A good quality wireless mouse shipped to your doorstep in two days for less than $15 spells winner to me. It might be petite, boarder line boring, and void of any whiz-bang features, but it works out of the box and you can have it very soon if you order now. I prefer a mouse over a track pad anytime and consider one of these a necessary add to any laptop.
customer_reviews.author: TexasTea

customer_reviews.title: Too small for larger hands.
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse overall, but much too small for my hands. I bought two, but will let my wife keep the open one and return the other for a slightly larger mouse for myself. If you have large hands definitely stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier S.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life. Durable. Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Very responsive. Great battery life. Logitech is the best brand for a mouse, hands down. Even for Logitech, this is great for a basic mouse. I've never seen a mouse that only takes one battery that lasts this long. I usually buy a dual batter mouse for longevity, but in this case one battery seems to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: BJC

customer_reviews.title: I love this one
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. But I think it is too soon to say something about its sturdiness. My previous mouse (not wireless, though) lasted for 10 years. I've used this one not even for 1year yet, so it's kinda hard to say because my mouse before this and after that 10-year sturdy mouse only lasted less than 3 months. I'm giving this 5 stars because the delivery and the service is great, and so far its performance is great, too. We'll see how long this will last. Hopefully it can last longer than the previous one. Hhe
customer_reviews.author: jUwa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mouse
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mouse for it's wireless feature and am satisfied with it. It feels pretty good in the hand and covers the display screen with one sweep. I don't have to pick it up and down to stay on the mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: J G.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased one for my office because I hate wires everywhere and have since purchased another for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for my office because I hate wires everywhere and have since purchased another for my home. Fits the hand perfectly, great reception, batteries last forever. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned 2 of them
customer_reviews.text: Made wrong or something, I have an older one which still works, and I ordered two more for other computers of my family and both were junk, never worked at all. ! Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is awful. Ive had Logitech mouses before very similar to this one and they were great but this one is terrible. The scrolling wheel didn't work well from the very beginning and the mouse itself stopped functioning after almost no usage. I even replaced the battery thinking I had let the juice run out by not turning it off but no, it simply ceased to function. I threw away the package already like a dummy so I can't return it but what a waste of money. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Annoying sound of the scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works fine and is almost perfect except the sound of the scroll wheel. The sound reminds me certain high pitched noise like something scratching on irregular surface. I hope this can improve over time.
customer_reviews.author: H. W

customer_reviews.title: The mouse that roared!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it's just a computer mouse, but it really works very well in every possible way, and I am 100% completely satisfied with it. If I ever need another wireless mouse, I will buy this one again. I highly recommend you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Churvis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at exactly 3 years
customer_reviews.text: The mouse has been great until now, almost exactly 3 years from when I purchased it and coincidentally, as soon as the warranty ran out. I hate to contribute to the proliferation of tech waste, but now I have to buy another piece of technology and throw this one away. I will look for a mouse that will last longer than 3 years. It would be great if tech companies were motivated to create products that last. 20 to 50 million metric tons of e-waste are disposed worldwide every year. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: BRITTANY STARR

customer_reviews.title: plain and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one,wore the first one out,its plain and easy to use not all the other buttons and scrolling to use,I use it on my laptop,good mouse, great price
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is tight!
customer_reviews.text: This really is a long lasting mouse! I use it daily at work and it takes a YEAR before I need to change out the AA battery. It works so well that I've gotten a couple of them.
customer_reviews.author: GigasWerden

customer_reviews.title: Scroll Wheel Issue
customer_reviews.text: I may be returning this soon. I ordered this mouse, because I had a previous version. After six years of constant use, the scroll wheel failed. This new one seems lower quality than my first one. AND more to the point, the scroll wheel seems to be "skipping" and does not scroll consistantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop mouse
customer_reviews.text: Always loved Logitech... my keyboard, mouse and speakers are all Logitech; so when I needed a small laptop mouse I naturally went with Logitech. Mouse works great, feels good in the hand, and the bluetooth adapter... which works extremely well and hasn't died on me like others have... stores inside the mouse for travel. Only wish it came in a few colors as I would have liked it to match my new notebook... after 30+ years I'm suddenly tired of all my electronics being black, black and gray, and black. Still, I chose Logitech for it's quality rather than color so I'm more than pleased.
customer_reviews.author: rainydays

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase if you will use it on a glass table...
customer_reviews.text: Great feel, and lightweight... my only issue is that it doesn't work well on a glass table, which is why i had to return it. It works, but with a lot of effort compared to other models. The mouse on the table feels great slides and doesn't drag, but in my experience had a delayed reaction to the mouse on screen... and doesn't mimic well... with that being said it works great and reacts well on other surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: TENGUmixD

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Not the best mouse in the world. However, they work with all the Logitech antennas and they are inexpensive. Great mouse to throw in the laptop bag, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The little mouse that could....
customer_reviews.text: This simple mouse is well designed and very responsive run off the USB button. It has everything I want and need and performs much better than more complex mice I have used in the past. It feels very substantial and makes me wonder why I ever tried any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B. Reed

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: picked this up for my 10 year old son to use with his chrome book. So far, so good. I'm sure it gets some steady use at school, and it keeps on tickin'.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Took a minute to figure out why it wasn't responsive. Had to have both mouse dongle and keyboard either paired together or use both dongles.
customer_reviews.author: The Doll Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement mouse
customer_reviews.text: My old Logitech M305 died suddenly and this one is a great replacement. The only confusing thing is it apparently uses infrared LEDs so you don't see a red glow when you lift it up. Since there was no light I though it was broken but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: darryl u

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a mouse - it's cheap and works well, comfortable grip. The center button does not click as well as you would like though. But it's so much better and much more reliable than anything else at the price point. The original Microsoft Optical Mouse was that felt better in my hand, but they don't make it the same anymore, and Logitech has been a better option now.
customer_reviews.author: CLTGUY

product_meta.title: Logitech Wireless Mouse M185 - Swift Gray
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackLogitech Wireless Mouse M185. A simple, reliable mouse with plug-and-play wireless, a 1-year battery life and 3-year limited hardware warranty.(Battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions.) System Requirements: Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|Mac OS X 10.5 or later|Chrome OS|Linux kernel 2.6+|USB port
feature_bullets: Plug-and-play wireless: Get a reliable connection from a convenient nano receiver that stays in your computer
1-year battery life: Go for a full year without a battery change (Battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions)
Logitech reliability: Made by the global leader for mice and backed by a 3-year limited hardware warranty
Contoured shape: Gives you more comfort and control
For Windows and Mac computers: No software or setup hassles-start using your mouse right away

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,134 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
